intro: Lomaria fraxinea, commonly known as the white-fringed lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Lomaria fraxinea thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
